quote: Medical log, Stardate 42437.5.   Ira Graves is arguably the   greatest human mind in the known   universe...
For years he's lived in near   isolation on a remote planet,   devoting full time to his   revolutionary work...
Eight hours ago, we monitored a   message from his assistant,   urgently requesting medical aid.   It seems Graves' health is failing   rapidly -- I only hope we can   reach him in time...
Any response from Gravesworld,   Mister Worf?
Nothing sir. Not since their   initial communication.
They send out a plea for help,   then shut off the transmitters   so they can't tell if help's on   the way. Doesn't make much sense,   does it?
What's our e.t.a. at the planet,   Mister Crusher?
Thirty-six minutes to orbit, sir.
You understand the importance of   doing everything we can for Doctor   Graves.
Of course, Captain.
Starfleet Command believes his   work in quantum physics is   reaching a critical stage. They   consider this a priority one   action.
A man is ill, Captain. Treating   him is my priority one.   Regardless of who he is.
It's wonderful. What is it?
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: A year on the planet Thurasia is   four hundred and ninety days long.   It rains twice, and only twice.   You're drinking Thurasian rain   water.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Water? Tastes more like...
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Heaven.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Exactly. Where can I get some   more of this?
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: 'Fraid that's the last of it.   Next rainfall in a hundred and   sixty three days.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: I'm not sure I can wait that long.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Hey, old friend. Any luck?
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: I believe my quest has ended in   complete success.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Data's been scouring the library,   in search of the perfect joke.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: I have explored seventy-six   thousand, two hundred and   twenty-three anecdotes thus far.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Why, Data?
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: It is an attempt to find the most   humorous anecdote in recorded   history. And I believe I have   done just that.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: This I gotta hear.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: There were twelve birds sitting   on a fence... Six had a notion   to fly away. How many were left?
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Okay, I'll bite. Six.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: No, twelve! They only had a   notion to fly away!
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: You did not find it wildly   hilarious?
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: What do you think?
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Perhaps I should have described   the interesting plumage of --
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: -- Data honey, I don't think it   would've helped. That joke   chilled my blood.
scene: 4    INT. TEN-FORWARD ROOM - CLOSE ON TROI

quote: Receiving a transmission from   Gravesworld, sir. It's unfocused.   Not directed specifically at us.
scene: 8    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MOVING WITH GEORDI

quote: On screen, Mister Worf.
scene: 8    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MOVING WITH GEORDI

quote: ... If anyone can hear me, please   send a doctor. Things are getting   worse --
scene: 8    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MOVING WITH GEORDI

quote: Try and raise her, Mister Crusher.   Tell them we're minutes away.
scene: 8    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MOVING WITH GEORDI

quote: It's no good, sir. I don't   believe they're receiving us.
scene: 8    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MOVING WITH GEORDI

quote: Our records show that she and   Graves are the only ones living   on the planet, Captain.
scene: 8    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MOVING WITH GEORDI

quote: Then what scared her?
scene: 8    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MOVING WITH GEORDI

quote: Sir, I'm picking up another   signal... but it's not from the   planet.
Confirmed. Point of origin...   sector three-five mark seven.
Signal is very weak, sir. Audio   only.
Pipe it through, Mister La Forge.
... Mayday! Mayday! This is       -- questing emergency assistance.       Outer hull breached       Environmental systems compro --       Need immediate
I show the Mary Rogers in that   general vicinity, Captain. She's   a transport ship, used to ferry   settlers to new colonies. No   other ships of any kind in this   sector.
Outer hull breached -- their air   must be leaking out.
There may be hundreds of colonists   aboard that ship. We've got to   help them!
And what about Graves?
He's one man. And we don't even   know the nature of his illness.
He's the man we came to assist!   I have my orders, Doctor.
Suggestion, sir.

Suggest we execute long range   transport of away team to assist   Dr. Graves at earliest possible   moment. We can use the mass of   the planet to slingshot us toward   the stricken liner, thus making   up most of the lost time.
Mister Crusher, make it so -- prepare   for extended touch and go orbit.
Aye sir.
The transport may be a bit tricky.   I'd like you to handle it, Mister   La Forge.
Understood, Captain.
Assemble an away team, Number One.   Include whatever medical   assistants the Doctor deems   necessary.
Excuse me sir, but I'd be more   useful dealing with the Mary   Rogers. There may be hundreds   who'll need attention --
-- Thank you Doctor, but I'll make   those decisions.       You're going to Gravesworld.
I cannot comprehend it. It is   beyond my ability to reason.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Don't feel too bad, Data. Humor   is subjective.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: But this anecdote had all the   elements humans find so diverting!   A play on words, colorful   characters, deception, a lively   setting --
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: -- Maybe it's the birds.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Interesting. How so?
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Birds are considered to have   boring personalities. They just   sit around and eat seed all day.   Maybe squawk once in a while.   Boring.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: In fact, there's only one thing   birds do that's funny, but you   couldn't put that in a joke and   keep it tasteful.       Now chickens. Chickens are funny.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Hello Guinan. Keeping this guy   out of trouble?
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: It's a challenge, but I'm trying.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Excuse me sir, but in what way   is Guinan attempting to restrain   me from adversity?
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Never mind, Data, I was only   joking.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: That joke was funny. Was it not?
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: It wasn't meant to be, Data.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Are you really going down to see   Ira Graves? The Ira Graves?
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: How did you know about that?
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Remember Will -- great men have   great egos.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: Come on Data. A great man awaits.
scene: 12   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON DATA AND GUINAN

quote: May I ask a question, sir?
I think you just did.
Quite correct. May I ask you   another question after this one?
Sure, what's on your mind?
Do you think it is pointless for   me to try and understand humor?
Pointless? Not necessarily.
I believe that comprehending what   is truly funny will bring me   closer to... humanness.       Until recently, I thought I was   making progress.
For example Commander, do you find   this amusing? There were   twelve....... aquatic fowl sitting   on a fence, and six had --
-- Twelve. They only had a notion   to fly away.
How did you --
-- Are you kidding? That joke's   become a legend on this ship.
Phaser on stun, Mister Worf. We   don't know what's going on down   there; no need to take chances.
scene: 16   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WORF, PULASKI, TROI (OPTICAL)

quote: Agreed, sir.
scene: 16   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WORF, PULASKI, TROI (OPTICAL)

quote: Remember folks, this is a long   range transport. The effects will   be a little unusual.
scene: 16   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WORF, PULASKI, TROI (OPTICAL)

quote: How do you mean?
scene: 16   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WORF, PULASKI, TROI (OPTICAL)

quote: Understood. Energize.
scene: 16   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WORF, PULASKI, TROI (OPTICAL)

quote: Wait a minute! I don't under --
scene: 16   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - WORF, PULASKI, TROI (OPTICAL)

quote: -- ssstttaaaaaannnnddd!
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: You do now.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Ohh... I know this is crazy, but   for a moment I felt like I was   trapped inside that wall.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: You were. For a moment.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Riker to Enterprise.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Go ahead, Number One.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: We've arrived in Graves' home.   All's quiet so far -- on the other   hand, no one knew we were coming.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Use caution and investigate.   Protect Graves' health at all   cost. We're leaving orbit to   assist the Mary Rogers. Back as   soon as possible.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Understood, Captain. Riker out.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Let's look around -- see if   anybody's home.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Someone is home, sir.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: You heard me. Thank God.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I'm Kareen Brianon, Doctor Graves'   assistant. Are you... you with   Starfleet?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Yes, we're from a ship called the   Enterprise. We monitored your   distress call but you never   acknowledged our response.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I'm sorry, I... couldn't take the   chance...
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: What chance?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: The chance that I might find out   someone was coming.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Kareen knew full well that I would   not be pleased.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I had no choice. I refuse to   stand by and watch you   deteriorate.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: What symptoms have you noticed?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: He has pain, shortness of breath,   irritability --
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: -- Ridiculous! I'm as healthy   as a Rigellian ox!
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: We'll see about that, Ira.       I hope one of you is a doctor.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Doctor Katherine Pulaski. Call   me Kate.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: No offense, but I don't want you   touching me in a medical way.   It's no secret that I don't like   people much, and I like doctors   even less than people!
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Funny, I always thought doctors   were people.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: And you were wrong. Just ask any   patient.       Although I will admit for a doctor   you're a nice looking woman.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: And what have we here?... Another   lovely specimen of womanhood.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I thought you didn't like people?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I like women. Always try to   forget that they're people.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I'm Deanna Troi. It's an honor   to meet you Doctor Graves.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Yes! Yes, of course it is! This   is one of the truly great moments   of your life! Believe me honey,   you'll never meet anyone half as   sagacious as me. I'm a phenom.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Oh there I go again -- shocking   people with the truth. I can   appreciate how hard it is for   others to try and keep up with   my mind. I don't mean to burden   with my brilliance. It just works   out that way.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Excuse me sir... Are you a   Romulan?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Hardly.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: He's a Klingon, Kareen.       Kareen has lived here since her   father died when she was quite   young. Her only knowledge of   inhuman races comes from me. I   suppose Klingons and Romulans must   look much alike.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Do I have to stand here and be   insulted?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: No insult intended, Mister Klingon.       See Doctor? Nothing wrong with   my hearing --
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: My, my, my...
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Uh, Lieutenant Commander Data,   sir --
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: -- Shhh!
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Functional... Durable... Obviously   no concern whatsoever for   aesthetic values.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Looks like Soong's work.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Quite correct, sir! Did you know   Soong?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Know him?!       I taught him everything he knows.   You could say I was the father   of his work...    (smiles as thought     occurs)   Which kinda makes me your   grandfather, doesn't it sonny?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Damn doctors! Always sneaking   up on you like that -- saying this   isn't going to hurt, this isn't   going to hurt, when you both know   it's going to hurt like hell!       Well I'm not paying the bill for   this!
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: There won't be a bill, Doctor.       May I speak with you privately?
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: What for! Anything you think you   found's more my business than his!
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Go on, gorgeous! Whatever the   hell it is, I can take it.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I checked twice to make certain...   You have Varnay's disease.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I'm sorry, Ira. You're dying,   and there's nothing I can do about   it.
scene: 17   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Captain's log, Stardate 42437.7.   We've successfully transported   the passengers and crew of the   stricken liner Mary Rogers.
Tragically, six people died in   the initial explosion, but the   rest are now aboard and in good   condition. We are heading back   to Gravesworld with great   dispatch.
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: You wanted to see me, sir.
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: Yes Ensign. I assume you would   very much like to meet Doctor   Graves.
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: Yes sir. His theories on spatial   relationships are amazing! And   his work in thermodynamics is --
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: -- Good, I get the idea.   Providing his health is reasonably   intact, I'm going to appoint you   as his personal tour guide when   he comes aboard. You have the   run of the ship -- show him   anything you think he'll find   interesting, and for heaven's   sake, don't talk his ear off!
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: Yes sir. Understood.       But why me, sir? I mean, not that   I'm complaining --
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: -- Graves has a reputation for   being difficult and I'm not sure   I have the patience for that right   now.
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: And... sometimes the very old get   along best with the very young.
scene: 22   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - MOVE IN ON PICARD

quote: I'd say he has a week, but that's   a guesstimate.
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: Is he in great pain?
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: Some. I could help with that but   he won't let me get near him.
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: He won't even let me get near him,   now.
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: Has he been... like a father to   you?
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: More like a teacher.
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: I sense that his feelings for you   are very warm. He's attracted   to you in many ways.
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: Attracted?... I know -- I've felt   certain feelings from him. But   he's always been a gentleman.       Had I been older... perhaps we   could've been lovers. But nothing   like that ever happened between   us.
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: Now, it's like he's afraid to face   me... The only one he talks to   is your friend, Data.
scene: 23   INT. LIVING ROOM/GRAVESWORLD - ANGLE FAVORING PULASKI

quote: I have noticed Doctor, that you --
-- Call me Grandpa. Seems more   touching in my final hours.
I have noticed Grandpa, that you   keep repeating the same notes of   a musical passage that I am   unfamiliar with.
It's an ancient little tune called   "If I Only Had A Heart." A rather   plaintive lament sung by a   mechanical man who longs to be   human. It's his only wish.
What happens to this man?
He finds out that he is human   after all. Always was -- just   worried so much he never realized   it.
A happy ending. The mechanical   man got his wish.
Stories often have happy endings.   It's life that throws you for a   loop.
It must be hard for you... So   close to being human and yet never   really knowing what it's like to   feel pain.
But... pain is unpleasant... is   it not?
Pain... Lust... envy...   pleasure... desire. Do you know   what desire is, Data?
Desire? It is to long for or   crave, a wish, a request, a --
-- Do you know what desire is?
No... I do not suppose I will ever   know what it really is.
I feel pity for you. Your   existence is a kind of walking   purgatory -- neither dead nor   alive, never really feeling   anything. Just existing. Just   existing.
Listen to me -- a dying man taking   the time to mourn a man who will   never know death. Funny, isn't   it?
Funny?... I have... difficulty   discerning what is funny.
I've had the same difficulty most   of my life. We're much alike.
I just spoke with the captain.   The Enterprise is minutes away;   he'll contact us again when she   goes into orbit.
scene: 25   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - RIKER

quote: You informed him of Doctor Graves'   condition?
scene: 25   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - RIKER

quote: Yes. Arrangements are being made   to make his last days with us as   comfortable as possible.
scene: 25   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - RIKER

quote: It'll be strange to leave here.
scene: 25   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - RIKER

quote: You're a beautiful young woman,   and there's a whole universe   waiting for you out there.
scene: 25   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - RIKER

quote: I'll be alone. I'll be without   Ira.
scene: 25   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - RIKER

quote: I know what it is to lose those   closest to your heart. It will   be hard... you will feel alone   at first... but it will surely   pass, as time passes. I know.
scene: 25   INT. LIVING ROOM ON GRAVESWORLD - RIKER

quote: You mentioned your impending death   a while ago. I must say Grandpa,   that you are facing it with   remarkable courage and stoicism.
That is because I am an incredible   man, possessing an iron will and   nerves of steel. Two traits that   helped me become the genius I am   today as well as the lady-killer   I was in days gone by.
You condone homicide, sir?
It's an expression, Data. It   means I was once as beautiful as   I am smart.
Really Grandpa?
No, not really -- but what the   hell, I'm dying. I can remember   my life any way I want.
And I'll tell you a little secret,   Sonny. I don't think I truly will   be dying.
But... the doctor --
-- Oh I'll die, but I won't really   be dead. You see?

I've invented a way of   transferring consciousness into   a computer. Before I die I plan   to convey my great intelligence   into this machine, thus cheating   the Grim Reaper of his greatest   prize.
Grim Reaper... Is that a farmer   with no sense of humor?
I speak of the personification   of death itself.       But what do you know of death?   It is a subject forever alien to   you.
Well Grandpa, that is not   necessarily true. I do have an   "off button" if you like. Its   activation robs me of all   consciousness -- therefore   rendering me dead for all intents   and purposes.
It is not something I enjoy   contemplating.
I can understand that; still the   analogy is a good one.       Just where would Soong position   such a device? Don't tell me,   let me guess.
Welcome to Gravesworld, sir. This   is Kareen Brianon, Doctor Graves'   friend and assistant.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: I'm very sorry, Ms. Brianon. I'm   sure this is quite difficult for   you.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: Thank you, Captain. Your people   have been most kind to me.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: Where's Data?
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: He's been with Doctor Graves   almost the entire time. They seem   to have developed a genuine   rapport.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: Hmm, I suppose I can understand   that.       I think we should immediately   transport to the ship. There are   patients from the Rogers who   could use some of your medical   savvy.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: Injuries?
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: Nothing serious.       But I'd also like to get Doctor   Graves to a place where we can   make him more comfortable.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: That will not be necessary,   Captain.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: Explain yourself, Data.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: It happened in my arms, just a   few moments ago.       There is no need to hurry... Ira   Graves is dead.
scene: 27   INT. GRAVES' LIVING ROOM - THE SAME CAST AS BEFORE

quote: Captain's log, Supplemental. I   leave Gravesworld with an empty   feeling and the knowledge that   our mission was unsuccessful.   Whatever scientific secrets Ira   Graves was about to unlock will   follow him to his grave...
Our immediate priority is to reach   the nearest starbase so that   Graves' assistant and the marooned   settlers can get on with their   lives.
And he really believed he could   transfer his intellect into a   computer?
That is correct. Unfortunately   he never had the opportunity to   elaborate. Death came swiftly.
Why didn't you notify Doctor   Pulaski when it started to happen?
To do so would have been   pointless. There was nothing she   could have done.
It's probably right. My   preliminary report indicates an   extremely rapid heart stoppage.   Death was almost instantaneous.
I am not an "it," Doctor. You   have been duly informed of this   on several occasions, yet you   continue to label me with that   abhorrent pronoun.
Data... I realize you liked Doctor   Graves a great deal.
He was the greatest man I have   ever known.
Does his death disturb you?
Disturb, Captain? No. All things   must pass.       May I go now, sir?
Yes of course.
We will try and do the funeral   the way he wanted, will we not,   Captain?
I told you we would, Data.
I am glad, sir. It was his dying   wish.
That's interesting.
Hmm?
I thought he said death came   swiftly. When did Graves have   time to make a dying wish?
Perhaps beforehand. Perhaps he   had a premonition.
Hello Data. It's good to see you   again.
The stars are so beautiful when   seen from space. Yet they seem   lonely -- each so isolated from   the next.
Ira... never told you how   beautiful you were to him. He   never told you that, did he?
He could not tell you, do you   understand?
Yes. I understand.
But he wanted to. Every waking   moment.       And he wanted you to know that.
Data!       How do you know? How do you   know... what he thought of me?
He told me.
Captain Picard.
What is it?
I heard about the ceremony you're   having for Doctor Graves, and...   well sir --
-- You wish to attend.
Since I never got to meet him...
I think it's a fine idea. Come   along, Wes.
... The temperature should be   seventy-two, no make it   seventy-one degrees. And whenever   the name Ira Graves is mentioned   it will warm considerably --
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: Are we the first?
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: You are the last. The others have   congregated inside.
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: Very good.       Enter.
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: Perhaps the child would be better   off playing somewhere else. This   is an adult ceremony after all.
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: The child? You still working on   your sense of humor, Data?
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: You don't seem yourself lately.   Are you feeling all right?
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: Of course, sir. I am as healthy   as a Rigellian ox.
scene: 36   INT. ENTRANCE TO HOLODECK - ON DATA

quote: ... Although we hardly knew him,   we certainly knew of him. His   reputation spread throughout the   galaxy, and his mind touched all   who cherish science.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: We gather here today, to say a   respectful good-bye to Ira   Ellsworth Graves. A man who --
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: This is not exactly what he   wanted.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: You programmed the setting. The   field, the mountain range --
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: -- It is not the environment that   I question, Commander. This was   one of his favorite places on   Gravesworld.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Well what is it then?
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: It is the tone, the pacing, the   content of the verbal tribute.       No offense Counselor, but Doctor   Graves would have desired a   slightly more personal address.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: And how can you be so sure?
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Why he told me, of course.       Perhaps I should take over, sir.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: If you promise to be brief. When   I agreed to this, I didn't intend   for it to interfere with our   duties. Understood?
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Perfectly.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Just look at that face. The face   of a thinker, a warrior, a man   for all seasons.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Yes friends, Ira Graves was all   that and more.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Ira Graves was a great   humanitarian.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: To know know know him, was to love   love love him. But Ira Graves   was not perfect.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Data...
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Perhaps his greatest fault was   that he was too selfless. Cared   too much for his fellow man.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: Data! That's enough!
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: I am almost finished sir.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: You are finished, you mean.
scene: 37   INT. HOLODECK - CLOSE ON THE FACE OF IRA GRAVES

quote: What's become of your judgment?
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: Perhaps I am maturing, sir.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: Do you consider it mature to   program the mountains to tremble   every time you say the name, Ira   Graves?
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: Not to mention the air warming   at the very thought of him. We   would've been barbequed if we'd   stayed much longer.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: I seem to have overdone it.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: To put it mildly.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: I brought shame to this ship.   To the good name of Starfleet.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: Data --
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: -- I was only trying to carry out   his wishes. To make sure I kept   my promise.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: I know that Data.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: Look... I realize you've been   studying the human equation with   great alacrity, but maybe you've   been trying just a little too   hard. Do you know what I mean?
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: Try and relax a little. Don't   try to be so... "human." Just   be yourself. Okay?
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: (serious, just a touch     of sadness)   Affirmative, sir. I will work   on staying within myself. Now   if you will excuse me, I am due   on the bridge.
scene: 43   INT. OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER AND PICARD

quote: I'm concerned, sir. I've never   seen him act like this.
scene: 45   INT. ENTERPRISE CORRIDOR - TRACKING PICARD AND RIKER

quote: Could it be that grandfather   analogy Graves planted in his   head?. Data is an orphan in a   manner of speaking. Maybe the   loss of Graves really got to him.   Touched him emotionally.
scene: 45   INT. ENTERPRISE CORRIDOR - TRACKING PICARD AND RIKER

quote: I hope that's all it is.
scene: 45   INT. ENTERPRISE CORRIDOR - TRACKING PICARD AND RIKER

quote: It's Captain Picard and Commander   Riker. May we come in?
scene: 45   INT. ENTERPRISE CORRIDOR - TRACKING PICARD AND RIKER

quote: We've come to pay our respects,   Miss Brianon.
scene: 46   INT. KAREEN'S QUARTERS - PICARD AND RIKER

quote: Thank you, gentlemen. That's most   thoughtful.
scene: 46   INT. KAREEN'S QUARTERS - PICARD AND RIKER

quote: We're due at Starbase Six in less   than twelve hours. We thought   you might enjoy a quick look at   the bridge before we arrive.
scene: 46   INT. KAREEN'S QUARTERS - PICARD AND RIKER

quote: Can one see the stars from up   there?
scene: 46   INT. KAREEN'S QUARTERS - PICARD AND RIKER

quote: Oh yes. Closer than you've ever   seen them before.
scene: 46   INT. KAREEN'S QUARTERS - PICARD AND RIKER

quote: I think I'd enjoy that very much.
scene: 46   INT. KAREEN'S QUARTERS - PICARD AND RIKER

quote: That was a great speech, Data.   To know know him is to love love   love love love him?!
Taken from a centuries-old Earth   composition. Your child-like mind   cannot appreciate the timeworn   wisdom of its words.
You're not turning into a   star-crossed artist on us, are   you Data?
I am many things: artist,   scholar, lover, genius --
You're getting funnier, I gotta   hand it to you.       There's something to be said for   that deadpan delivery.
You're looking in the general   direction of the constellation   Pegasus.
I'm aware of your interest in   science. Perhaps you'd like to   --
-- And I am aware of your interest   in her.
What was that, Data?
Nothing sir. Nothing at all.
These are our science stations.
What's wrong with you?!
I detest hypocrisy. I wish they   would just come out and admit it.
Admit what, Mister Data?
That your interest in Kareen is   not entirely honorable.
Data! You are way out of line!
Try as you might, you cannot win   her heart. She does not like   older men...       ... or men of limited intellect.
Mister Data, you are hereby relieved   of duty -- Worf, take his station.
Yes sir.
You will report to your quarters   immediately. You will not leave   there until you hear otherwise   from me. Is that understood?
Sure, I understand.       I understand all too well.
Removing the competition will not   help you, Picard.
Do you know what that was all   about?
Jealousy... I sensed intense,   burning jealousy. And it was   coming from Data!
I heard what happened but I just   can't believe it.
Do not trouble yourself, friend.   I am sure the captain will be by   to apologize shortly.
You expect him to apologize?
It seems I was too harsh on Soong.   Notice the strong chin, the finely   chiseled features, the powerful   torso. Do you realize that this   body will never wear out.       Immortality.
What the hell are you talking   about?
He's not himself, sir. I know   him better than anybody.
We're going to Sickbay.
Oh? Are you ill, sir?
I'm getting there. Come along.
I don't oil machinery.
Why don't you take it down to   Engineering?
Because I brought him to you.   I want a complete medical check   run on him immediately.
I'll do the best I can --
-- I expect nothing less.
-- But if it blew a fuse or   something I may not pick it up.
I have the utmost faith in your   abilities, Doctor. I know nothing   will get by you.
I'm sure there's a reason you're   looking at me that way.
I am simply looking. Any thought   of ulterior motive rests with you.   Perhaps you are projecting your   own desires.
Perhaps not. I've had three   husbands dear, and they've all   been flesh and blood. For some   strange reason I like it that way.       Now shut up and turn over.
Very well. It is your loss.
Wait for me in the corridor, Mister   Data.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: What for? This concerns me more   than it does any of you.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: You will wait for me in the   corridor!
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: His insubordination is growing   by leaps and bounds. I could   throw him in the brig but I'd   rather try and help him.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: Well I really don't know what to   suggest. Physically it's fit as   a fiddle. Granted it's not easy   to examine a tin can the size of   a human, but I'll be damned if   I can find anything wrong with   it.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: Perhaps we're looking in the wrong   place, sir.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: Explain.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: Well, Data's physical health may   be unimpaired but it's his mental   health that needs to be addressed.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: Are you suggesting it's losing   its mind?
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: With your permission Captain,   there's one way to find out.
scene: 59   INT. ADJOINING ROOM IN SICKBAY - DATA

quote: You remember the psychotronic   stability examination, don't you   Data? We all had to take it   before graduating from the   Academy.
It was a waste of time then and   it is a waste of time now.
Just watch the screen and let your   mind go blank. This little   machine will do the rest.
It's safe to say you're his best   friend. Can you speculate on   what's happening to him?
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: It's just a guess sir, but, well   sometimes he wants to be human   so bad he can taste it. And   sometimes he is more human than   he or we realize.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Yes...
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: I think your theory might be   right, Captain. Witnessing   Graves' death may have been the   catalyst --
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: I have the results of the tests,   Captain. I -- I ran two tests   to make certain.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Make certain of what?
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: There are two distinct   personalities within Lieutenant   Commander Data.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: What?! He's an android, that's   not possible!
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Nevertheless it is true. The   second personality is the   dominant. It is unbalanced:   brilliant but vain, sensitive yet   paranoid. I believe it is also   capable of extreme acts of   violence.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: So that's it...
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: What was that, sir?
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Nothing. Go on.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: It seems to have an especially   strong hatred of you, Captain.   Or to a lesser degree, any   authority figure.       And worst of all, it's growing.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: How do you mean?
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: The alien persona is getting   stronger -- gobbling up what's   left of the original Data.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: If we don't find a way to stop   it immediately, the Data we knew   will be gone forever.
scene: 65   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI (OPTICAL)
location: CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Where is he now, Counselor?
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: I left him in his quarters. He   still has orders not to leave.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Orders? Which personality will   choose to obey my orders?
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Tell me -- where is Lieutenant   Commander Data?
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD AND GEORDI

quote: Hello Kareen.
You know who I am, don't you?
You're -- you're Data.
You know who I am. Don't you.
Ira?...
It is me, Kareen! I'm here -- I'm   alive!
How?
The process worked! I turned Data   off and transferred my   consciousness into his frame.
Just look at me! Sleek, powerful,   indestructable.
When I was a boy, other children   knew I couldn't match them   physically. They teased me -- bullied   me. That's when I   withdrew... Became an island.
But no one will ever bully me   again.       If they try, I'll simply break   their necks.
Don't talk that way, Ira. I've   never known you to be violent.
I've never been capable of   violence. But now I'm more than   capable -- and I rather enjoy this   new ability.
Excuse me Data, but the captain   would like to see you.
Of course.       If you will excuse me, Miss   Brianon.
You're just the type, aren't you?   You'd beat me up if you could,   but you can't. Not any more.
Ira, no.
Stay out of it!       You're lucky I'm such a   compassionate man. Now walk!
There's something I must do -- something   they're forcing me to   do. I'll come for you when my   task is complete.
Ira... I don't understand...   what's happening to you?
Something wonderful. I feel no   pain, no pain at all! And I'm   immortal -- I'll never have to   face death again. Think of the   things I'll accomplish over the   next thousand years!
I know what you're thinking, but   there's no need to worry. I'll   create an android body for you   as well. We'll witness the end   of infinity together.

Don't cry, Kareen.       Don't you see, I can love you now.   The way I've always wanted to.   It wouldn't have been right   then... I was too old for you,   too weak. But now I can be   everything you've ever wanted.
Ira -- you're hurting me!
I'll be back. Wait for me.
Ohhh, what hit me?
Did Data do this?
But it's not really Data.
Yes. I realize that now.
Security alert -- all decks.   Lieutenant Commander Data may be armed and   dangerous. Use extreme caution   and subdue. All phasers on stun.
Well hello there. You all look   like you could use a little   vacation.
scene: 70   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - GEORDI AT COMMAND

quote: Captain Picard -- I have ordered   your people to vacate the bridge   and they have refused. In an   effort to save insignificant lives   I will give you the opportunity   to issue the same order.   Otherwise, I will remove them my   way.
That phaser's set to kill,   Captain.
Data. That's your best friend   you're threatening. That's   Geordi. You wouldn't harm him   for the world, would you?
Geordi?
Yes Data. It's me.
He's no friend of mine! I should   kill him on the spot -- put him   out of his blind misery.
You win -- no need to act rashly.   Mister La Forge, you and the rest   of the bridge crew will vacate   immediately.
I'll blast anyone who attempts   to reenter.
You will make no attempt to   recapture the bridge. Is that   clear, Geordi?
Yes sir. Evacuating now.
Maybe I should shoot one in the   back just to let you know I mean   business.
What is it you want? Tell me!
Kareen is with us! You want to   talk to Kareen.
Kareen? Are you there?
Yes -- yes Ira. I'm here.
They're all against me, Kareen.   They want to drive me out of this   body. To kill me!
We're going to a new world, my   darling. A place where no one   can ever touch us. Just hang on,   and trust in me.
Riker to bridge, Riker to bridge.       It's no good. He deactivated the   monitor.
We must remember that we're   dealing with an unhealthy mind,   ravaged by Varnay's disease as   well as the strain of assimilating   into a new body.
And that "unhealthy mind" is in   total control of this ship.
Yet he seems to have a purpose.   He said something about going to   a new world.
Do you know what he meant by that?
Is there anything you can tell   us about Ira Graves that will help   us to understand?
He's a wonderful man. He's not   like this --
-- He's taken over my ship! And   I want her back!       Are you going to help me?
How can I help?
By rejecting him! By deflating   his ego.
Yes, he said he was doing this   for you. Saying you want nothing   to do with him might distract him   long enough --
-- I won't hurt him! He's sick,   I won't help to destroy him.
It might be our only hope! He   controls all life-support systems   on this ship. He could start   killing us like flies.
I can't do it, don't you   understand?
Yes, I suppose I do understand.
Where are you going, Captain?
To the bridge.
I can't let you do that, sir.
You have no choice, Number One.   Should I fail to return I want   you to attempt an external bridge   separation. Get all of our people   as far away from him as possible.
You can't just walk in on him!   He won't hesitate to kill you.
There's still some of Data inside.   I know there is. If I can reach   him, maybe we've still got a   chance.
I could've killed you. You know   that, don't you?
I do know that. I also know you   haven't killed anyone so far.   I don't think you really want to.
Where are we going?
To the Aldebaran system. There's   a planet there that suits my   purpose.
Which is?
Why should I tell you?
Because you're lonely. Because   you want someone else to share   your plans.

I'll tell you... because I'm   bored. I plan on building a   fortress, with a laboratory of   course. Those of your crew that   I do not exterminate shall live   there as our slaves. Kareen will   never want for anything.
And what of Data? Your   "grandson."
What of him?
You took advantage of him.
I did him a favor! I gave him   life!
You killed him! You're nothing   but a two-bit murderer!
You call me a murderer?! I'll   show you what murder is.
Stop it!
You've become a monster.
Don't say that, Kareen. He   attacked me --
-- And a liar as well.
I hate you. I despise you.
Kareen... don't...
You're not a man anymore! You're   a pathetic little pile of   machinery!
Stop... please...
The thought of ever living with   something like you makes me sick.
I'd rather live alone! I'd rather   make love to a computer!
Are you going to kill me too?
You hate me... What can I do, what   can I do?
Leave that body. It doesn't   belong to you.
Data! Data, can you hear me?
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: May I ask you a question,   Commander?
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: I think you just did.
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: Quite correct. May I ask you   another question after this one?
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: No questions. Just tell me a   joke. The funniest joke in   history.
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: All right. There were twelve...   starship captains, sitting on a   fence --
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: -- I've heard more than enough   to know you're you again.
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: He's in there. Ira put himself   in the computer.
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS

quote: No Kareen. The real Ira Graves   never left the planet.
scene: 75   INT. DATA'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON THE DOORS
